article.headline: Buffalo gets by Texas Arlington 74-68
article.story: ARLINGTON, Texas -- Shannon Evans scored 24 points and had five assists, Will Regan added 15 points, and Buffalo beat Texas Arlington 74-68 on Tuesday. Jarryn Skeete scored 13 points and Justin Moss added 11 for the Bulls (2-1). Buffalo had a slight edge in shooting from the field (38.9 percent to 38.8 percent), but made 24 of 31 free throw attempts to 7 of 15 for Texas Arlington. Erick Neal led the Mavericks (1-1) with 15 points, Lonnie McClanahan had 12, and Johnny Hill 11. The Mavericks led 13-12 at 12:23 on a jumper by Kevin Hervey, trailed, then tied it at 28 on a 3-pointer by Neal. Reagan hit a trey and Xavier Ford made a layup in the final seconds to give the Bulls a 35-31 halftime lead. Buffalo led 59-52 at 8:04 in the second half on a jumper by Moss, then used an 8-0 run to stay ahead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
